topic: Deep dive: calendar standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: calendar standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Calendar Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide to the Calendar module in Python 3.12+, explaining its key features, usage, and examples.
key_points: The Calendar module is a built-in library in Python that provides functions for creating calendars and working with dates.
It offers flexibility to display calendars in various formats such as text, HTML, and PostScript.
The module can handle leap years and customizable week starts.
It also includes functionality for finding the day of the week or month for a given date.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ includes improvements and enhancements to the Calendar module, such as better performance and additional features.
For best results, use Python 3.12 or later versions.
caveats: While the Calendar module provides extensive functionality for working with dates and calendars, it may not be suitable for complex date-related tasks that require more specialized libraries like pandas or datetime.
Always ensure compatibility with your target Python version when implementing solutions using the Calendar module.
